meanings.definition: Remove a tube from (a patient's body)
meanings.sent1: The doctor will be extubating the patient after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The nurse carefully extubated the patient to help them breathe on their own.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tube feel sad when the doctor was extubating it?
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to be extubating the clouds, revealing a clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The magician performed a trick by extubating a long scarf from his sleeve.

meanings.sent1: The technician will be extubating the machine to fix the issue.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic extubated the engine to replace the damaged part.
meanings.sent3: The coffee maker seemed surprised when someone started extubating it.
meanings.sent4: The IT specialist was like a wizard, extubating the computer to make it run faster.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully extubated the hose from the sprinkler system to repair it.
